website_summaries.verdict: The Wacom MobileStudio Pro offers a unique solution for the creative nomad who needs power and flexibility a little more than portability -- and isn't constrained by affordability.
pros: The tablet has an exceptionally good feel and pressure-sensitivity capability, plus it can serve multiple functions depending on your needs
cons: Wacom's chintzy when it comes to essential accessories, the battery life's not great and it's expensive

customer_reviews.title: Software glitches hamper an otherwise great product
customer_reviews.text: I fully updated the system software, the firmware, and product software (Adobe, etc.). It randomly crashes (freezes) at least once a week while I'm in the middle of a project, the express keys stop working at least once a day and I have to go into task manager to restart the Wacom driver services to get the keys working again, and at least a few times a week it cannot connect to WiFi after booting up - forcing me to reset both my modem and router before it'll pick up the signal again. If it weren't for these issues, I would easily give the Mobile Studio Pro at least 4.5 - 5 stars. It's great when everything is working properly.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph K Mahi

customer_reviews.title: There are no words
customer_reviews.text: This product is a bit too good. Six stars! She is my new wife. It's got an amazing, vibrant screen. I use Corel 2018 and between the beautiful responsiveness of this amazing tablet and that fantastic program, my sketches glow off the digital page. The heft is lovely, the whole machine is so smooth and beautiful. Wacom is a magical wizard of mechanical sorcery. NOTE: It only has USB C slots. Until the present catches up to this beauty, you might need a USB C adapter. It's only because she's a time traveler from the future.
customer_reviews.author: D. Kimerly

customer_reviews.title: I am nearly able to reattach this without sleeping the machine it falls off so often
customer_reviews.text: After attaching it fell off... after reattaching... it fell off. After putting in case... it fell off. After removing from the case... fell off. While in use, bump the tablet ... you guessed it, it fell off. Stand and bump the desk (coffee showed slight visible ripples from the bump)... fell off. If this were aftermarket, I might accept this inability for it to remain attached during below average usage. However, this was made by and for wacom mobile studio pro. Why do I need to reattach it 2-5 times an hour?
customer_reviews.author: Not My Real Name

customer_reviews.title: No casting to TV
customer_reviews.text: First one burnt out during first start up. Had to return it to get a new one. So this one works good. Down side Microsoft wants your money and placed a lot of things on this tablet to prevent you from doing work. Second no casting available. So if you have a project you created and want to show it to family or friends via casting... wont work. I think if you purchase another app something along the lines of cost 300$... you can cast to TVs. It's a shame they are down right greedy. I would have given them more stars. But not like it matters. They're rich. Lol
customer_reviews.author: James Acosta

customer_reviews.title: It's ok but no really portable.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this hoping to to use it as a mobile workstation but the poor battery life and set-up was just annoying. I ended up selling it and just got a better specced laptap and a Wacom intuos and I found this combo to be more portable and more powerful. The laptop I got has thunderbolt 3 so I can hook up an egpu as well for a little graphics boost.
customer_reviews.author: Jbro808

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING MACHINE GETCHA ONE!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This machine is amazing!!!! Pricey you say?? Yes! Worth it you ask??? YES!!!! Worth every penny!! This machine has made my life so much easier! Has performed flawlessly the entire time and would definitely recommend it!!! Dont second guess the price as its worth every penny!! Wish it had a lil more storage but I have an external hard drive for that!!!! GETCHA ONE!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Russell Allen

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT PURCHASE
customer_reviews.text: After owning and using this product for 5 months, I wish I had never purchased this product. From day one it always has had some issue. Pen not working, touch not working. Now after working with support I get told the unit must be sent into their facility for evaluation that will take 10-14 days. While the unit is flaky it stills my daily computer and what I rely on for my livelihood. 10-14 days is insane for a repair. I get next day service with my Dell products and any other computers that I have purchased before. Wacom is a disappointment in terms of customer service, reliability and repair.
customer_reviews.author: Wil

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT buy this product
customer_reviews.text: I am very upset with this product. It simply does to work! I contacted Wacom customer support and they are absolutely useless. This tablet is not functional, I really wish I did not put all my budget into this device. It always needs an update and every time it has a new issue afterwards. Sometimes it even locks me out, because it stops recognizing my finger prints. I really wish there was something that could be done to return my money as I do need a tablet for work and now I don't know what to do. My best of advice, do not buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Kanevsky

customer_reviews.title: Excellent stand! Fits the MobileStudio Pro like a glove
customer_reviews.text: Excellent stand! Fits the MobileStudio Pro like a glove. It's really cool that this stand attaches to the machine so that I never have to carry them separately. It virtually adds no width to the tablet and is incredibly comfortable to use. The clicking noise when attaching and removing parts of the stand can be a little loud and scary at first but I quickly got addicted to it. The stand is very stable. It allows me to lean on the tablet freely while using it to draw or write. I often use the tablet standing up with an attached keyboard and mouse combo for a classic laptop usage experience.
customer_reviews.author: Shahar Korren

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for artists. Seller was awesome.
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as described and in excellent condition. Works perfectly and is a awesome tool for visual artists. Seller was great, communicated well, and shipped the item super quick.
customer_reviews.author: bossypants

customer_reviews.title: Love this
customer_reviews.text: When it comes to drawing computers these people are the best and their quality is second to none. Does the computer seems fine and has been working I will have to say that the packaging was very poorly done. I am surprised it arrived in as good a condition as it did. If I was able to read the shipping it would be one star and I would only give it that star because it didn’t get to me.
customer_reviews.author: Fit over 50

customer_reviews.title: like under 4 hours
customer_reviews.text: I run zbrush on it, so battery is on short side, like under 4 hours, and its less stable compare to my desktop, also sometimes screen garma change for no reason when running zbrush, have to restart program. but, there isn't any other laptop can do what this can, so leave me no choice
customer_reviews.author: M. yu

customer_reviews.title: Great Stand, way too expensive
customer_reviews.text: I really like this stand—It makes it much more easy for me to use my laptop w/ my 16" cintiq pro, and i like all the angles. However, I really dislike that it's $90. It's well made and improves my working experience a lot, but I feel that it should sell for about $50
customer_reviews.author: Achro

customer_reviews.title: Not very secured. Bad design, bad engineering, bad product.
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with this stand. It detaches at the slightest movement. If you want to move your Mobile Studio Pro a few inches across the desk, as soon as you carefully slide it, the stand "snaps" out and the tablet collapses on its weight if you're not there to catch it. It's very annoying having to reset the stand after every malfunction. Bad design, bad engineering, bad product.
customer_reviews.author: Hiram Maxemin

customer_reviews.title: Loved this device for first month
customer_reviews.text: Loved this device for first month. Now pen intermittently will not select menus or buttons, right click function is flakey. Pen always tracks but selections are off.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: She could not be more thrilled and has been on it daily producing amazing work! Great product-Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my daughter for her college graduation from SVA. It's the only thing she wanted-we split the cost with family since it was quite high priced but worth EVERY penny!! She could not be more thrilled and has been on it daily producing amazing work! Great product-Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: RKCad

customer_reviews.title: I am very pleased with this stand
customer_reviews.text: Even though it took way to long to come out and I coughed up extra cash buying additional stands in the meantime.....I am very pleased with this stand. It probably wouldn't be so epic without the 6 months+ of anticipation, so there's that. I would hope that Wacom listens to its users more in the future.
customer_reviews.author: kyle

customer_reviews.title: Maybe find an alternative stand
customer_reviews.text: It's okay. It gives out sometimes and the rubberised feet have come loose. It's definitely not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Useless and Expensive
customer_reviews.text: This won’t stay on the companion at all, horrible design. It’s completely useless to me.
customer_reviews.author: Xanthe Harris

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: The Windows 10 unwanted features notwithstanding, the mobile studio is a great product. I purchased it not so much as an artist but as a tool to help me with my vision issues. I recommend getting a stand for it, however, if you cannot get it almost vertical the screen is a little fuzzy. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This thing is pretty awesome. For one thing
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about this after my experience with the older Cintiq. This thing is pretty awesome. For one thing, it is metal rather than the old plastic. Still should have been included with the Mobile Studio Pro and $99 is way too much, but it is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Jaime Wojick

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected but the locking and unlocking system feels ...
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected but the locking and unlocking system feels tight and I sometimes think I may break it off.
customer_reviews.author: Grailwing

customer_reviews.title: I love this guy
customer_reviews.text: I love this guy. It's just a really great, slick product. Now, it can be argued that there are other great options on the market now, for a fraction of the price, but I will say that this has been the best of the bunch that I've tried so far.
customer_reviews.author: DRomens

customer_reviews.title: It's Not worth the bugs, and has trouble running Photoshop.
customer_reviews.text: -The RAW Camera program doesn't work -Glitches on and off when you let anything go full screen -Doesn't work well with google chrome -Battery life is 2 hrs if your lucky -I optimized Photoshop, and it would freeze over pen movements
customer_reviews.author: Everett

customer_reviews.title: Perfection!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! Love this product, it is perfect for my artwork and is also great for gaming! It is everything that is advertised, even better than expected. My new favorite drawing tool!
customer_reviews.author: smokymountainstitcher

customer_reviews.title: Great stand
customer_reviews.text: This is very low profile for ther wacom mobile studio. Well worst the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Henry Fulcher

customer_reviews.title: Lack of Service.  Mediocre product.
customer_reviews.text: The tablet itself had rendering errors. When I used another laptop I bought to replace this one, I rendered the same graphic and had no issues. This is an interesting concept. The worst part of this product was, the service absolutely sucked. I will never buy another Wacom product until I hear that they have gotten rid of this support group located, from what I am told, was Central America.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Trautmann

customer_reviews.title: frustration guaranteed
customer_reviews.text: Every time when there's an update something will break. Bluetooth, password pin. pen, something will not work for a long time before it finally get fixed. This is a wonderful tool for art, but for a 2000+ dollars computer, it is just too much frustration from Wacom. This is a shame.
customer_reviews.author: Po-Chen Y.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome stand for mobile studio pro.
customer_reviews.text: It is super slim, love the 3 levels. I am always on the go and every now and then use it on a train finally feels so comfortable with the stand. Very sturdy structure. Great product overall.
customer_reviews.author: Serge

customer_reviews.title: Must have for Wacom MobileStudio Pro
customer_reviews.text: This works great ! Very versatile, I highly recommend this stand . The fit, function and style are perfect
customer_reviews.author: DreamzSupreme

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Love it best purchase ever wish it wasn't a super expensive but it works extremely well it's meets all my expectations
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: the data line of the keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Everything is fine, but I didn't see the data line of the keyboard...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I can't believe I went a year without this
customer_reviews.text: Super portable and convenient. It attaches to the back near the rear camera and fits perfectly in the case
customer_reviews.author: jona

customer_reviews.title: Ok until out of warranty. Pricey for a one year item
customer_reviews.text: Update... 2 years later. Hate it! Battery has started to swell and causing the screen to separate from the body. CPU gets so hot you can barely stand to draw on it, even with small files and restarting photoshop or illustrator regularly. I had to replace the pen after it started behaving oddly and Wacom's support "solutions " worked until it was out of warranty. I also had to replace the AC charger after it quit working. If you are going to buy it make sure that you buy the protection plan with it. After 2 years this is how I feel--nice to draw on a monitor, everything else sucks.
customer_reviews.author: bunnbunn

customer_reviews.title: The battery was not charging to 100%
customer_reviews.text: The battery had some issues that would not allow it to charge more than 87%.
customer_reviews.author: K.Assar

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: le produit correspond à ce qui est décris sur l'annonce et est envoyé très rapidement :)
customer_reviews.author: christopher TARTERAT

customer_reviews.title: Best Artist's Tablet and it is a full computer
customer_reviews.text: Solid, dependable, very effective for artistic development. Photoshop or Painter, Art Rage or Essentials it is great. Wacom make the best graphic tablet. Having that tablet on the screen you are looking at is fantastic. Being a powerful computer running Windows is a plus. You will want the Wireless keyboard for Office.
customer_reviews.author: Howard

customer_reviews.title: Poor monitor support and lack of stand makes this a hard sell.
customer_reviews.text: Extremely poor support to connecting multiple monitors. I want to sketch on this one the go then bring it home and work as a proper laptop/workstation. Monitor support was absolutely terrible. Could get s second monitor hooked up but the. The tablet would end up controlling the second screen rather than the tablet screen. Could not find a solution. Returned it after several day. Also the lack of a stand was extremely annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Heit

customer_reviews.title: Either wait until they've got the hardware bugs figured out or buy something else.
customer_reviews.text: Completely bricked in less than three months, right after the warranty ran out. Plagued with graphics issues and hardware issues. I don't know why I expected anything different; the exact same thing happened with Companions 1 & 2. I'm in the process of getting a hold of customer service; they're usually pretty good about it but regardless, if you're spending $3000 on a unit, it needs to be more reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Caytlin Vilbrandt

customer_reviews.title: Wacom's Best Mobile Tablet yet
customer_reviews.text: Having come from the Cintiq Companion 2, this is a definite step up. A full Windows 10 computer with all that Wacom pen stylus love. Cons: A bit pricey, no Stand, 3-USB C Ports but no adapters for your standard USB flash drives or external hard drives.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Allen Borchert

customer_reviews.title: it's great, i don't give it five stars mainly because ...
customer_reviews.text: it's great, i don't give it five stars mainly because Substance Painter seems to disagree with it, making the pen incredibly jittery or even crashing, because performance is not as good as i expected (although it's pretty good), and because they stripped it from accessories from the last version. if you use maya, zbrush, photoshop or manga studio ( I've been using it for profesional work everyday in all of these) this works perfectly. be warned though you will have to spend at least an extra 100$ to 200$ on accessories. overall i don't regret buying it i have not encountered any bugs and it's been pretty awesome to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It gets uncomfortably hot on the right side.
customer_reviews.text: The tablet is nice overall, but my pet peeve is having to touch computational devices that get warm or hot. They should have moved the CPU or whatever is generating all of that heat to the top or the left of the tablet. The hot spot is in the absolute worst place it can be: right under your right hand while it's resting on the right corner while drawing. If you're left handed you lucked out. I have to flip this thing over where the buttons are under my right hand and set it on top of a platform so it doesn't touch my lap so I can use it somewhat comfortably. Extremely disappointed in this.
customer_reviews.author: John Doe

customer_reviews.title: Slightly pricey but great. Works similar to the other Wacom stands but ...
customer_reviews.text: Slightly pricey but great. Works similar to the other Wacom stands but they extra strength, clip in mechanism and rubber feet actually make it a really convenient sturdy stand. Certainly would of preferred it to of actually come with the $4.5k tablet but I guess they eventually got around to it.
customer_reviews.author: Perry

customer_reviews.title: Inventory incomplete
customer_reviews.text: The tablet is o.k. It works o.k. Well packaged But sadly the inventory said it came with 6 nibs and it came with 3, we have no idea why.
customer_reviews.author: Juliana Alvarez

customer_reviews.title: It works great the first time I mounted it
customer_reviews.text: It works great the first time I mounted it. After awhile it becomes a little loose and would not stay in position if you move your mobile studio by lifting it. It shouldn't be a problem for use on table though.
customer_reviews.author: Livia Marvella

customer_reviews.title: pretty good! but I think I still need a ...
customer_reviews.text: pretty good! but I think I still need a keyboard, not good thing is battery power cannot hold too much time
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Shipping method poor, product perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I don't like the way they shipped this. They left it unwrapped so that anyone would know what it was. I could've used a bit more discretion. The product itself is robust and lighter weight than its predecessors!
customer_reviews.author: abigail marie bickel

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: My husband has been using it since he got it and he loves it. It works like a charm and even plays games nicely.
customer_reviews.author: adohm2016

customer_reviews.title: I knew this wasn't a good sign, but hoped for the best regardless
customer_reviews.text: Received one today and right away I noticed the box was not factory-sealed and damaged a bit even though I had ordered it as a brand new item. I knew this wasn't a good sign, but hoped for the best regardless. It turned on fine, but the pen wasn't working at all with the Pro. I contacted customer support and they sent out a replacement with one-day shipping speed which is nice, but now I have to wait again and hope that I receive an actual working product. Not a first good impression right off the bat with this Pro. I'm more than skeptical now to say the least of this replacement one working without issues...
customer_reviews.author: Chaunc

customer_reviews.title: If it was possible to give ZERO stars, I would!
customer_reviews.text: Right out of the box, there is a fine pink line down the center of the screen. Bad Display. This is going back and I will NEVER attempt to purchase another WACOM stand alone tablet computer product again. The defective screen is probably the tip of the iceberg with the problems that will come up and I do not have time to waste wrestling with this thing. This product COULD be wonderful but Wacom missed several details such as a case/stand. Come on! for 3000 bucks, it better come with this stuff! JUST SAY NO! and do not be tempted to buy it. Its not worth the 3grand.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Strunks

product_meta.title: Wacom DTHW1320H Mobile Studio Pro 13 Windows 10, Intel Core i7, 512GB SSD
product_meta.description: Capacity:13"| Style:EnhancedDesigned for professionals who want the freedom to create anywhere, Wacom Mobile Studio Pro 13 packs an entire studio full of powerful creative tools into a line of lightweight 13.3" Mobile pen computers. All four models feature 4x higher pen accuracy and pressure sensitivity, computing power configurations capable of running demanding creative 2D, 3D and CAD software, high resolution displays (2560 x 1440) and exceptional color performance (80% Adobe RGB coverage in CIE1931) in a mobile display. In addition to a complete range of creative features such as customizable Express Keys and multi-touch controls, there is also a DTHW1320H with an integrated Intel RealSense camera for capturing 3D scans. Mobile Studio Pro 13 is the only creative tool you need to carry.
feature_bullets: Wacom's most natural and advanced pen performance with 4x greater accuracy and pressure sensitivity and virtually lag free tracking
Professional computing power and Graphics options to run the most demanding 2D and 3D creative and card applications
3D ready; Capture 3D scans with the Built in Intel real Sense Camera and scanning software (available on select models)
Remarkable clarity with high resolution displays (2560 x 1440) and superior color quality (80 percentage Adobe RGB coverage in CIE1931)
Wacom Stand now available (sold separately) holds your Wacom MobileStudio Pro in 3 comfortable drawing angles and folds flat for easy transport and storage

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.6 out of 5 stars188 ratings3.6 out of 5 stars
